skill.name: web-artifacts-builder
skill.description: Suite of tools for creating elaborate, multi-component claude.ai HTML artifacts using modern frontend web technologies (React, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui). Use for complex artifacts requiring state management, routing, or shadcn/ui components - not for simple single-file HTML/JSX artifacts.
skill.summary: Suite of tools for creating elaborate, multi-component claude.ai HTML artifacts using modern fronten...

security_audit.summary: This is an official skill from Anthropic. A minimal audit was performed and no issues were found. The scripts focus on local project setup and bundling.

content.value_statement: You need complex HTML artifacts with routing, state, and UI components. This skill creates a full React stack and bundles it into one HTML file.
actual_capabilities: Creates a React and TypeScript Vite project with Tailwind CSS
Pins Vite for Node 18 compatibility when needed
Installs shadcn/ui and Radix UI dependencies
Adds path aliases and configuration files
Bundles the app into a single HTML file with inlined assets
limitations: Requires Node.js 18 or higher and pnpm
Assumes index.html exists in the project root
Bundles only after installing Parcel and html-inline
Not intended for simple single file HTML artifacts

output: Created bundle.html with all scripts and styles inlined
Verified index.html entry point in project root
Reported bundle size and ready for Claude artifact sharing

best_practices: Use Node 18 or higher before running the scripts
Keep index.html in the project root for bundling
anti_patterns: Run the bundle script outside the project root
Skip pnpm install steps before bundling
Use this skill for simple single file HTML artifacts

faq.question: Is this compatible with Node 18 and 20?
faq.answer: Yes. The script detects Node and pins Vite for Node 18 compatibility.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It requires pnpm and an index.html in the project root.

faq.question: How do I integrate with an existing repo?
faq.answer: Run the init script in a new folder, then merge files into your repo.

faq.question: Does it send my code anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The scripts run locally and do not upload project files.

faq.question: What if bundling fails?
faq.answer: Check pnpm install, ensure index.html exists, and re run the bundle script.

faq.question: How does it compare to a simple HTML artifact?
faq.answer: It is heavier but supports React, Tailwind, and shadcn components.
